alert.note: Alert for Harris; Montgomery (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 15 at 8:08PM CDT until May 18 at 4:00PM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas... West Fork San Jacinto near Humble affecting Montgomery and Harris Counties. Lake Creek at Sendera Ranch Road affecting Montgomery County. Cypress Creek at Katy-Hockley Road affecting Waller and Harris Counties. For the West Fork San Jacinto River...including Sendera Ranch Road, Humble...Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Cypress Creek...including Katy-Hockley Road...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...West Fork San Jacinto near Humble. * WHEN...Until Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 50.3 feet, Moderate lowland flooding begins as homes on Lake Point Drive in the Northshore subdivision begin flooding and roads in the Bellaeu Woods subdivision are inundated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 PM CDT Monday the stage was 49.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this evening to a crest of 50.1 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage early Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 49.3 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 50.1 feet on 09/01/1980. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (8 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Thu West Fork San Jacinto Humble 49.3 49.2 Mon 7 pm CDT 50.0 49.6 48.5 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Tuesday morning at 815 AM CDT.
